intro: Ochna sambiranensis, commonly known as the Sambiranensis ochna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Ochnaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature, contributing to its reproductive strategy. Ochna sambiranensis is notable for its ecological importance in its native habitat, supporting local biodiversity.
